p: ADS has enabled a range of medicinal chemistry strategies to be realised. It has enabled the discovery of ligands based on more constrained scaffolds (such as the AR modulators 1– 3 9); productive fragment growth (e. g., to give the AR agonists compounds 5– 11 11); expansion of compound series (e. g., the antibacterials 12– 15 12); and scaffold hopping (e. g., to give the p53/ hDM2 inhibitors 17– 20 14). In each case, ADS enabled the parallel identification of distinctive starting points for bioactive molecular discovery.
